intro: Hieracium taygeteum, commonly known as the Taygete hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is often found in southern Europe and parts of North Africa.
